alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:53PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wichita and southern Greeley Counties through 845 PM MDT/945 PM CDT/... At 753 PM MDT/853 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Modoc to near Horace. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Wichita and southern Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Lydia, Marienthal and Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
